result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jorge A. Cortez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jorge A. Cortez in court.  Attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present.  Defendant appears without counsel. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing. Indigency hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-25-22

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No driving without a valid license. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Jorge A. Cortez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Margo Elise Clark appeared by video for Jorge A. Cortez. Attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY. 
Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 1 and 4.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Jorge A. Cortez not in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/22/22 @ 2p
